class MEDfl.rw.client.FlowerClient(server_address, data_path='data/data.csv', dp_config=None, val_frac=None, test_frac=None, id_col=None, test_ids=None, seed=42)[source]ïƒ

Bases: NumPyClient

Federated learning client for MEDfl real-world pipelines.

This client:

  • connects to a Flower server,

  • loads local CSV data,

  • applies server-provided schema (features/target),

  • handles train/val/test splits (fractions or test_ids),

  • optionally enables differential privacy with Opacus.

Parameters:

  • server_address (str) â€“ Address of the Flower server, e.g. "127.0.0.1:8080".

  • data_path (str, optional) â€“ Path to the local CSV file. Default is "data/data.csv".

  • dp_config (DPConfig, optional) â€“ Differential privacy configuration. If None, DP is disabled.

  • val_frac (float, optional) â€“ Client-side validation fraction override. If None, use server value.

  • test_frac (float, optional) â€“ Client-side test fraction override. If None, use server value.

  • id_col (str, optional) â€“ Name of the ID column used when selecting test samples via test_ids.

  • test_ids (str, optional) â€“ Comma-separated list of IDs (or line numbers) to use as test set.

  • seed (int, optional) â€“ Random seed used for splits. Default is 42.

_lazy_init_from_server_config(config)[source]ïƒ
Build model and (train, val, test) loaders once, using:

  • Server-enforced schema: config[â€˜featuresâ€™] (comma-separated), config[â€˜targetâ€™]

  • Split fractions: client overrides win; else use serverâ€™s val_fraction/test_fraction

  • NEW: if config[â€˜test_idsâ€™] is set (per-client from strategy), use ID-based split

evaluate(parameters, config)[source]ïƒ

Evaluate the provided parameters using the locally held dataset.

Parameters:

  • parameters (NDArrays) â€“ The current (global) model parameters.

  • config (Dict[str, Scalar]) â€“ Configuration parameters which allow the server to influence evaluation on the client. It can be used to communicate arbitrary values from the server to the client, for example, to influence the number of examples used for evaluation.

Returns:

  • loss (float) â€“ The evaluation loss of the model on the local dataset.

  • num_examples (int) â€“ The number of examples used for evaluation.

  • metrics (Dict[str, Scalar]) â€“ A dictionary mapping arbitrary string keys to values of type bool, bytes, float, int, or str. It can be used to communicate arbitrary values back to the server.

Warning

The previous return type format (int, float, float) and the extended format (int, float, float, Dict[str, Scalar]) have been deprecated and removed since Flower 0.19.

fit(parameters, config)[source]ïƒ

Train the provided parameters using the locally held dataset.

Parameters:

  • parameters (NDArrays) â€“ The current (global) model parameters.

  • config (Dict[str, Scalar]) â€“ Configuration parameters which allow the server to influence training on the client. It can be used to communicate arbitrary values from the server to the client, for example, to set the number of (local) training epochs.

Returns:

  • parameters (NDArrays) â€“ The locally updated model parameters.

  • num_examples (int) â€“ The number of examples used for training.

  • metrics (Dict[str, Scalar]) â€“ A dictionary mapping arbitrary string keys to values of type bool, bytes, float, int, or str. It can be used to communicate arbitrary values back to the server.

class MEDfl.rw.model.Net(input_dim, hidden_dims=[64, 32], activation='relu', batchnorm=True, dropout=0.0, task='binary', num_classes=None, output_bias=True, return_logits=True, weight_init='kaiming')[source]ïƒ

Bases: Module

Flexible MLP with task-aware output. - hidden_dims: e.g., [128, 64, 32] - activation: â€˜reluâ€™ | â€˜geluâ€™ | â€˜leaky_reluâ€™ | â€¦ - batchnorm: apply BatchNorm1d after each linear (except output) - dropout: float in [0,1] or list per hidden layer - task: â€˜binaryâ€™ | â€˜multiclassâ€™ | â€˜multilabelâ€™ | â€˜regressionâ€™ - num_classes: required for â€˜multiclassâ€™; for â€˜binaryâ€™ ignore; for â€˜multilabelâ€™ set to label count - return_logits: always True for training (recommended). Use .predict() for post-activation outputs.

forward(x)[source]ïƒ

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

predict(x)[source]ïƒ
class MEDfl.rw.strategy.Strategy(name='FedAvg', fraction_fit=1.0, fraction_evaluate=1.0, min_fit_clients=2, min_evaluate_clients=2, min_available_clients=2, initial_parameters=None, evaluate_fn=None, fit_metrics_aggregation_fn=None, evaluate_metrics_aggregation_fn=None, local_epochs=1, threshold=0.5, learning_rate=0.01, optimizer_name='SGD', savingPath='', saveOnRounds=3, total_rounds=3, features='', target='', val_fraction=0.1, test_fraction=0.1, split_mode='global', client_fractions=None, id_col='id')[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Flower Strategy wrapper:

  • Dynamic hyperparameters via on_fit_config_fn

  • Custom metric aggregation

  • Per-client & aggregated metric logging

  • Synchronous get_properties() inspection in configure_fit()

  • Saving global parameters every saveOnRounds to savingPath

Extended: - split_mode:

  • â€œglobalâ€: use global val_fraction/test_fraction for all clients

  • â€œper_clientâ€: use client_fractions[hostname] if present

  • client_fractions:
    {
    â€œHOSTNAME_1â€: {

    â€œval_fractionâ€: float (optional), â€œtest_fractionâ€: float (optional), â€œtest_idsâ€: [..] or â€œid1,id2â€ (optional)

    }

  • In per_client mode:
    • if test_ids is present for a client:

      -> send test_ids -> do NOT use that clientâ€™s test_fraction

    • otherwise:
      -> use that clientâ€™s val_fraction/test_fraction if provided,

      else fall back to global val_fraction/test_fraction

  • client id in this mapping = hostname from client.get_properties()

  • id_col:

    • column name used on clients to match test_ids (default â€œidâ€)
